avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs have widely formed in high elevations after continuous SW and N winds, especially in gullies. Older snow is considered stable. Beware of terrain traps. Becoming warmer with rain on Saturday, potentially releasing wet avalanches.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Mostly light snow cover in the forecasting area, but windslabs can be found widely, especially in high elevations and in gullies after continuous SW and N winds. Snowprofile in Bláfjöll, 16/2, showed now response in CT. Snow is widely wind packed and older snow is considered stable. Avalanches can still occur in places like gullies so beware of terrain traps. Warm temperatures and rain on Saturday can cause snow cover to change rapidly with increased chance of wet avalanche activity.

travelAdvisory.comment: During warming over the weekend, avalanches may release across the country, either naturally due to rain and temperature changes or human triggered. Weak layers have been observed in the Eastfjords, Westfjords, and North Iceland. A snowmobiler triggered an avalanche above Fáskrúðsfjörður on Wednesday. It should be assumed that weaknesses are present in more areas. Snowmobilers traveling through Flateyjarskagi en route to Keflavík encountered four very wide avalanches that released on February 16th on north- and west-facing slopes. Widespread weakness is still found in the North at the interfaces of the older firn layer and new wind slabs. Therefore, people traveling in steep terrain should exercise particular caution.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Weak layers have been observed in Eastfjords, Westfjord and in the north. Weak layers can be present in other areas. Warming widely over the weekend and the snow may become unstable to begin with.

weatherForecast.highlights: Austlæg átt 10-15 hlýnar með rigningu á köflum. Suðlægari og lítilsháttar skúrir á sunnudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche fell in N-aspect in Súgandafjörður on Monday. Small collapses have been seen in W-facing hills this weekend.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Layered wind slabs are in all aspects. Observations indicate multiple weak layers in the snowpack and increased likelihood of human triggered avalanches. Becoming warmer on Saturday and the snowpack can become very unstable to begin with.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Layered wind slabs are in all aspects and weaknesses have been found between layers. Snow pits in the area from the 7th, 8th and 10th of February confirm this and compression tests have given a sudden collapse at 10-40 cm depth. Even though there is relatively little snow in mountains compared to the season, people travelling in steep terrain should proceed with caution as it can trigger dangerous avalanches. Frost in recent days is believed to have preserved these weaknesses. Becoming warmer on Saturday and the snow may become very unstable to begin with with increased chance of wet avalanche activity.

travelAdvisory.comment: During warming over the weekend, avalanches may release across the country, either naturally due to rain and temperature changes or human triggered. Weak layers have been observed in the Eastfjords, Westfjords, and North Iceland. A snowmobiler triggered an avalanche above Fáskrúðsfjörður on Wednesday. It should be assumed that weaknesses are present in more areas. Snowmobilers traveling through Flateyjarskagi en route to Keflavík encountered four very wide avalanches that released on February 16th on north- and west-facing slopes. Widespread weakness is still found in the North at the interfaces of the older firn layer and new wind slabs. Therefore, people traveling in steep terrain should exercise particular caution.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Weak layers have been observed in Eastfjords, Westfjord and in the north. Weak layers can be present in other areas. Warming widely over the weekend and the snow may become unstable to begin with.

weatherForecast.highlights: Austlæg eða hægbreytileg átt og hlýnandi veður með lítilsháttar úrkomu fram á mánudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: There have been no reports of avalanches in the area since a snowmobiler triggered a thick slab on a south-facing slope in Upsadal on February 10th. Prior to that, avalanches occurred in northerly directions last week in Ólafsfjörður, Svarfaðardalur, and across Ólafsfjarðarvegur.
avalancheActivity.highlights: There are unstable wind slabs on south- and north-facing slopes. Whumpfing has been observed widely in recent days, indicating that weakness is still present. Avalanches may release during warming over the weekend.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Wind slabs are on S- and N-facing slopes, after wind events from the north and a strong SW wind on Wednesday. Wind slabs are widespread on various aspects. Snowfall in northerly directions since has added new snow on S aspects. Weaknesses are present within the layered wind slabs. The wind slabs lie on a hard, melt-freeze layer, with faceted crystals on the interface. High temperature gradients were measured in a snow pit at Skarðdalur on February 16th. Tests have shown fractures in the snowpack, and avalanches could occur on steep slopes under heavy load. Whumpfing has been found across the region. Snowmobiles triggered an avalanche on layer 10.2. Avalanches could occur with rising temperaturesover the weekend and cornices may collapse.

travelAdvisory.comment: During warming over the weekend, avalanches may release across the country, either naturally due to rain and temperature changes or human triggered. Weak layers have been observed in the Eastfjords, Westfjords, and North Iceland. A snowmobiler triggered an avalanche above Fáskrúðsfjörður on Wednesday. It should be assumed that weaknesses are present in more areas. Snowmobilers traveling through Flateyjarskagi en route to Keflavík encountered four very wide avalanches that released on February 16th on north- and west-facing slopes. Widespread weakness is still found in the North at the interfaces of the older firn layer and new wind slabs. Therefore, people traveling in steep terrain should exercise particular caution.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Weak layers have been observed in Eastfjords, Westfjord and in the north. Weak layers can be present in other areas. Warming widely over the weekend and the snow may become unstable to begin with.

weatherForecast.highlights: Aðfaranótt laugardags þykknar upp og snýr í suðaustan 8-15, hlýnar og hiti fer yfir frostmark á laugardag. Hæglætisveður og úrkomulaust á sunnudag og frost ofarlega í fjöllum.

avalancheActivity.comment: Sowmobile triggered an avalanche above Fáskrúðsfjörður on Wednesday. Avalanches in N-aspect in Seyðisfjörður and S-aspect in Eskifjörður and Norðfjörður on Monday. Small avalanche in inner Bræðslugjá by Neskaupstaður from 7th or 8th of February.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Weaknesses have been found widely within the snowpack in the area. An avalanche was triggered by a snowmobile on Wednesday. Wind slabs are present in most aspects due to variable wind directions, snowfall, and drifting. Temperatures rise on Saturday with rain, and the snowpack may become unstable to begin with.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Weaknesses have been found widely within the snowpack in the area. A snowprofile in Oddskarð, 14/2, showed a CT2 at a depth of 60 cm, and a slab in Stafsdalur, 16/2, showed a CT4 at a depth of 13 cm. There was significant snowfall on Sunday evening and Monday in a north-northeast direction. Prior to this, wind slabs were present in east and south-facing aspects, particularly in gullies and depressions, following sharp northwest winds and blowing snow on Tuesday to Wednesday last week, which may be unstable. Warming on Saturday with rain may render the snowpack very unstable, with increased likelihood of wet avalanches.

travelAdvisory.comment: During warming over the weekend, avalanches may release across the country, either naturally due to rain and temperature changes or human triggered. Weak layers have been observed in the Eastfjords, Westfjords, and North Iceland. A snowmobiler triggered an avalanche above Fáskrúðsfjörður on Wednesday. It should be assumed that weaknesses are present in more areas. Snowmobilers traveling through Flateyjarskagi en route to Keflavík encountered four very wide avalanches that released on February 16th on north- and west-facing slopes. Widespread weakness is still found in the North at the interfaces of the older firn layer and new wind slabs. Therefore, people traveling in steep terrain should exercise particular caution.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Weak layers have been observed in Eastfjords, Westfjord and in the north. Weak layers can be present in other areas. Warming widely over the weekend and the snow may become unstable to begin with.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hlýnar með suðaustan 8-15 og rigning eða súld, snjór í efstu fjöll. Dregur úr úrkomu og vind á sunnudag.
